p:
In a study they showed that SARS-CoV-2 infected pneumocytes and enterocytes and non-infective in cells such as macrophages, bronchial epithelial and endothelial cells.
18 However, other studies support that SARS-CoV can replicate efficiently in lung epithelial cells, endothelial cells that also express ACE2 receptor, explaining to a certain extent the pulmonary pathogenesis related to SARS-CoV-2.
19
